channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Workmen dumping large piles of earth and rubble into the road., 21st February
item.description:
Starting on Monday 16th of February tradesmen, who are working on a garden behind one of the houses on Maple Road, started dumping earth, rubble and pallets into the road, and have continued to do it all week. It is Saturday the 21st of February and the mound is still there. This is illegal and they are blocking cars from being parked there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Melvin Road, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big potholes - here is how to save money, 21st February
item.description:
So more big potholes on this steeply hilly bit of road. That steepness is of course the problem. Cars brake amd the road erodes. In fact you are repairing this road at least annually amd it is still a mess. How about putting in a speed camera or those smiley 20 mph signs here? Slower traffic would mean far fewer holes here!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queenswood Road, Muswell Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
